summary: This document is a probable cause affidavit from the Palm Beach Police Department detailing an investigation into Jeffrey Epstein for lewd and lascivious acts involving minors. It includes sworn statements from multiple victims and witnesses, describing sexual abuse and exploitation that occurred at Epstein's residence, as well as the recruitment of young girls for these acts.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Jeffrey Epstein is the primary subject of the investigation, accused of engaging in sexual acts with minors and facilitating their recruitment for these acts.

persons.name: Mimi
persons.context: Mimi is identified as Epstein's assistant who facilitated the recruitment of young girls for massages and was present during some of the incidents.

persons.name: Haley
persons.context: Haley is mentioned as a recruiter who brought girls to Epstein's residence for massages, often under false pretenses.

persons.name: Molly
persons.context: Molly is another individual who recruited girls to provide massages to Epstein, often for monetary compensation.

persons.name: Joe Recarey
persons.context: Officer Joe Recarey is the officer who swore to the affidavit and conducted interviews with victims and witnesses.

persons.name: Tony Higgins
persons.context: Tony Higgins is mentioned in relation to conducting trash pulls at Epstein's residence as part of the investigation.

persons.name: Alfredo Rodriguez
persons.context: Alfredo Rodriguez is a former houseman for Epstein who provided information about the massages and the young age of the girls involved.

persons.name: Jose Alessi
persons.context: Jose Alessi is another former houseman who described the routine of massages at Epstein's residence and noted the young age of the girls.

persons.name: Jane Doe
persons.context: Several victims are referred to as Jane Doe or similar identifiers, detailing their experiences of abuse at Epstein's residence.

connections.description: Mimi worked as Epstein's assistant, facilitating the recruitment of young girls for massages.
Haley recruited girls to provide massages to Epstein, often under the guise of making money.
Molly brought girls to Epstein's residence for massages, contributing to the recruitment network.
Officer Recarey conducted the investigation into Epstein's activities and gathered testimonies from victims.
Rodriguez worked for Epstein and provided insights into the operations at Epstein's residence.
Alessi was employed by Epstein and observed the young age of the girls brought to the house for massages.

events.title: Initial Report of Abuse
events.description: A fourteen-year-old girl reported unlawful sexual activity that occurred at Epstein's residence.

events.title: Controlled Phone Call
events.description: Controlled phone calls were conducted to arrange another meeting with Epstein, revealing the ongoing recruitment.

events.title: Police Interview
events.description: Police interviewed a victim who had been brought to Epstein's residence, detailing the abuse.

events.title: Interview with Houseman
events.description: Interview with houseman Jose Alessi revealed the young age of the girls and the nature of the massages.

events.title: Victim Interview
events.description: A victim provided a sworn statement detailing her experiences of abuse at Epstein's residence.

locations: 358 El Grillo Way, Palm Beach, FL
keyFacts: The investigation involved multiple victims and witnesses who provided sworn statements about sexual abuse at Epstein's residence.
Victims reported being recruited under false pretenses to provide massages to Epstein, often involving sexual acts.
Epstein's assistant, Mimi, played a significant role in facilitating the recruitment of young girls.
Several former employees of Epstein confirmed the presence of young girls and inappropriate activities occurring at his residence.
Evidence collected included phone records, trash pulls, and witness statements that corroborated the victims' accounts.
